snippet: Parliament also voted Thursday to allow foreign forces to launch operations from Turkey, but it was far from clear if the political step would soon translate into military action.
abstract: Turkey's Parliament votes to authorize expanded military operations in Iraq and Syria and to allow foreign forces to launch operations from its territory; in many ways Turkey's stance is crucial question mark hanging over campaign against Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Parliament also voted Thursday to allow foreign forces to launch operations from Turkey, but it was far from clear if the political step would soon translate into military action.

headline.main: Turkey Votes to Allow Operations Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Turkey Votes to Allow Operations Against ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
